info.author: Kristian Ovaska
info.description:
File Selection Language (FSL) is a descriptive language for file selection.
It is used to selectively pick files from a directory structure.
FSL is useful for selective backups, for instance. FSL uses glob patterns
as the basic building block. For fine-tuning the selection,
inclusion/exclusion rule combinations and conditional expressions are
available. File size and modification date can be used in expressions.
info.name: fsl
info.summary: Specification language for selecting files from directory tree
info.html_description: File Selection Language (FSL) is a descriptive language for file selection. It is used to selectively pick files from a directory structure. FSL is useful for selective backups, for instance. FSL uses glob patterns as the basic building block. For fine-tuning the selection, inclusion/exclusion rule combinations and conditional expressions are available. File size and modification date can be used in expressions.
